ygData.subject: soft-404 detection
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi, For robustify.js (https://github.com/renevoorburg/robustify.js ) I ve been working on soft-404 detection. I

Content-Type: text/plain;

Hi,

For robustify.js (https://github.com/renevoorburg/robustify.js <https:=
//github.com/renevoorburg/robustify.js>) I've been working on soft-404 dete=
ction. I think Heritrix  (and the chain following it) would greatly benefit=
 from having such functionality. The approach taken in the robustify.js sta=
tuscode.php script seems to work pretty well (but to test it well I need a =
set of soft-404s and that would require some good soft-404 detection, a typ=
ical chicken - egg situation).

It would be beneficial to detect soft-404s =
because:
- essential they are 404s so knowing soft-404s helps to quantify a=
nd understand the web
- knowing soft 404s can help improve functionality of=
 search indexes
- soft-404s might be the source of crawler traps, so we pro=
bably will not want to use them to detect new urls
- in some cases we might=
 not even want to store soft 404s, which helps keeping the archive smaller
=
- ...

Having soft-404 detection will pose some questions. For example, how=
 to mark a soft-404 in a warc file? Do we simply overwrite the statuscode? =
Perhaps it is better to store it in the other metadata parts. I have no ide=
a how to do that in a warc. Further, do we want to store the random request=
 we need to be able to detect the soft 404 (using fuzzy hash matching)? How=
 do we mark this request in the warc (of don't we even record it?). Probabl=
y it is also handy to store the similarity between the soft 404 pages and t=
he and the random request. The required level of similarity should probably=
 be configurable.

If only I was more fluent in Java I would give implement=
ing this a try. Essentially it is a pretty simple algorithm. 

Looking forw=
ard to your thoughts and ideas.

Ren=C3=A9 Voorburg



--Apple-Mail=_F76CF3C1-5459-41DF-B135-F7C94A5D1BAF
